name: Suspense
overview: Suspense is a solitaire card game variant for the Commodore 64. It was developed by Maurice Jones and published iin Loadstar #198. In this version of Suspense all the cards are dealt face up to give a greater chance for use of strategy. The layout is supposed to be four, six-card pyramids. Each pyramid evolves into one foundation pile and two tableau piles. But don't worry if you aren't sure how to play, the computer will remind you when you try to make an illegal play.
